item.title: Papyrus Classic and Desktop
item.p: Hello Everyone, most of you would have already seen it but, just to broadcast it to the largest amount of people possible : the latest 6.7.0 release of Papyrus should be the last official release based on GMF diagrams and XWT property views. We are not planning to maintain a regular release schedule for this version now refered as Papyrus-Classic and available on the Eclipse Gitlab. The next version is already under development and will be contain major updates and its frameworks. Its diagrams will be based on the Eclipse Sirius diagram framework, its property view on EEF and the ElementTypes framework will gradually be replaced with the DomainService framework in charge of the UML editions. This 7.0.0 release is planned to be released aroung the 2024-12 GA. More information can be found on this forum post. For this reason, we might have to rework the current update sites and releases references under the usual Eclipse download server. We will make sure to keep you informed when this is happening, via both these news and the forum.

item.title: Papyrus 6.7.0 Released
item.p: The Eclipse Papyrus 6.7.0 2024-06 release is now available! Go to the Download page to install it as an update site or a zip archive. The associated RCP is available from the RCP download page as well. The first iteration of Papyrus Sirius is now also available to be installed as an update site for the latest release.

item.title: Papyrus 6.6.0 Released
item.p: The Eclipse Papyrus 6.6.0 2023-12 release is now available! Go to the Download page to install it as an update site or a zip archive. The associated RCP is available from the RCP download page as well.

item.title: Next Papyrus release : 2023-12
item.p: Papyrus won't be participating in the next 2023-09 release train and will publish its next 6.6.0 release for the next 2023-12 train.

item.title: Papyrus 6.1.0 Released
item.p: The Eclipse Papyrus 6.1.0 2022-03 release is now available! Go to the Download page to install it as an update site or a zip archive. Batik is now synchronized with the train at 1.14 and pointing to the new GMF-runtime/-notation releases. Old orbit reference has henced been removed. The Mac signing problem should have been fixed now.

item.title: Model2Doc Released
item.p: Model2Doc for eclipse 2021-12 release is now available! Go to the Market Place or use the update site to install it.

item.title: SysML 1.6 Released
item.p: SysML 1.6 for eclipse 2021-12 release is now available! Go to the Market Place or use the update site to install it.

item.title: Papyrus 6.0.0 Released
item.p: The Eclipse Papyrus 6.0.0 2021-12 release is now available! Go to the Download page to install it as an update site or a zip archive. We have reduced the dead code in the generated diagram code for GMF by introducing abstract classes. We have worked on tools to validate all customization models. We have added a library to be able to connect a Xtext editor as diagram editor or tbale editor. We have added a set of fixed bugs

item.title: SysML 1.6 Released
item.p: SysML 1.6 for eclipse 2021-09 release is now available! Go to the Market Place or use the update site to install it.

item.title: Papyrus 5.2.0 Released
item.p: The Eclipse Papyrus 5.2.0 2021-09 release is now available! Go to the Download page to install it as an update site or a zip archive. The associated RCP is available from the RCP download page as well.

item.title: Papyrus 5.0.0 Released
item.p: It is now possible to associate model explorer customizations to the architecture framework. Papyrus now requires Java 11 to run along with the 2020-12 eclipse releases and has trimmed down the number of re-exported bundles. Note that most of the 'relatives': Sysml 1.4, 1.6, Moka, designer... have also been made compatible with the new re-exports and the Java 11 migration. You can download the new release from the Download page to install it from an update site or a zip archive. The associated RCP is available from the RCP download page as well.

item.title: Papyrus 5.0.0
item.p: We will now begin to work on the next major release of Papyrus (5.0.0) in order to allow us some API changes and other corrections. This version will be available in time to integrate the 2020-12 release train. Because we need to focus on this goal, there is no release planned for the 2020-09 train. The 5.0.0 release will contain, for example, the refactoring of some dependencies such as removing the reexports wherever possible and removing deprecated APIs lingering for far too long in the code base. We will inform you about any work undertaken on the wiki page Incoming work for 2020-12.

item.title: Papyrus 4.2.0 Nightly RCP
item.p: Eclipse has stopped its support for 32 bits systems launchers. Papyrus 4.2.0 RCP and onward will not be released for 32 bits environments until a 32 bits launcher solution has been found.

item.p: Papyrus Team will make a new service release of Papyrus, Papyrus 3.4. This latter will be available on May the 21th.

item.title: Papyrus 4.0.0 Photon M6 milestone
item.p: The Eclipse Papyrus 4.0.0 M6 is now available! This milestone contains the newly released Test and Developer tools under the Toolsmiths category. You can see and install the new features in the latest Photon package by fetching them from the above mentioned update site. These will now be released with Papyrus UML to ease third party integration.

item.title: New videos in Papyrus youtube channel

li.a: "Modeling and Safety Analysis of Nao Robot"

item.title: Papyrus at Incose Edinburgh 2016
item.p:
Papyrus will be present in the Polarsys booth :
"Polarsys announcement"

item.title: Talks at EclipseCon France 2016
item.p:
Some presentations about or related to Papyrus will be given during EclipseCon France 2016 :
"Lessons Learned from Migrating Industrial Development from Proprietary Commercial Tool to Papyrus"
"Close Encounters of Requirements with SysML"

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter on Model-Based Engineering
item.p: This month, the Eclipse Newsletter focuses on Model-Based Engineering. Some applications of Papyrus for MBE and the last developments of Papyrus are presented in four detailed articles. Details here.

item.title: Papyrus, a full-fledged framework for empowering model-based engineering for better complex systems
item.p: Thanks to Papyrus, engineers from various industrial domains can put model-based engineering to work for their systems and software engineering projects. Details here.

item.title: Papyrus used to simplify distribution of computing tasks in complex systems
item.p: Researchers at List, a CEA Tech institute, have developed a technique and related tools based on Papyrus for distributing software across machines in complex systems. This novel technique is faster and more efficient than the traditional method. Details here.

item.title: EclipseCon NA 2016
item.p:
Some presentations about or related to Papyrus will be given during EclipseCon NA 2016 :
"UML gone wild: the Lego experience"
"Papyrus for Real Time: Executable modeling on Eclipse"
"Tailor-made model comparison: how to customize EMF Compare for your modeling language"

item.title: Papyrus 1.1.3 Released
item.p: The Eclipse Papyrus 1.1.3 release is now available!
Go to Download page to install Papyrus.

item.title: 2nd Papyrus Summit and EclipseCon Europe 2015
item.p: The 2nd Papyrus Summit will be held Tuesday November 3, 2015 in Ludwigsburg, Germany.
The Papyrus Team will also give a couple of presentations during EclipseCon Europe 2015 : "Papyrus4Java - UML diagrams for ordinary java developers" and "MDE with Papyrus, novelties and beyond"

item.title: Papyrus 1.1.0 Released
item.p: The Eclipse Papyrus 1.1.0 release is now available! Check the new features on the what's new? page.
You can install Papyrus from the Mars packages or use the Papyrus Downloads page

item.title: Save the date!

p.b: INVITATION BUSINESS BREAKFAST CEA TECH (WITH THE PARTICIPATION OF ERICSSON)

item.p:
Your system design needs modeling: Papyrus, the MDE open-source cutting-edge solution
Thursday, January 29th 2015, at hotel Napoleon Paris
If you cannot come to Paris, we invite you to join a web-conference on the same subject Friday, January 30th 2015 at 10 am

Why participate?
You will understand the strategic value of Papyrus modeling tool
You will understand how to leverage both standard modeling languages (e.g., UML and SysML) and domain-specific modeling languages.
You will listen and exchange around the feedback from the company ERICSSON
Send us an email to register (dils -at- cea.fr)

news.item: The Eclipse Papyrus 1.0.0 release is now available! For a short listing of the new features available in this release, check the release plan. You can easily install Papyrus from Luna packages or use the Papyrus Downloads page.
